column5: Hey everyone,  I heard a rumor that a bunch of people went thru the ice today near BBP on Lake Simcoe.  Has anyone else heard anything?  Stan
Never heard anything on theA channel Stan. I know of one thats heading there in the AM. Carefull out there.
A snowmobile close to shore and an ATV further out, but that's yesterdays old news.
As Fisherman says!!  That was Yesterday, 4 wheeler went in rider OK they got the Bike out last night.  Walking is OK!!  Leave the Toys at Home!!  See JohnnyB's post Simcoe PB  Rick
So all of Simcoe is of limits to ATV'S? I was planning on heading up there tomorrow!  Ab
Thanks, I haven't had access to much media over the past few days (too busy working).

no you are good to go in the beaverton and port bolster area and the south end of cooks bay with the atv's and sleds  there are already running the bombardiers in beaverton and I know Tim Hales will not run then without 12 inches of ice  it really depends on were you go it is a big lake  I was out with my ATV on wednesday about 3 km south of beaverton  11 inches of ice or better   and yes the perch were just hammering
was fishing snake 61-73 feet of water yesterday..ice was 6 inches of good black ice..sled did fine and got my first whitefish...
The back of that bike looks very familier.  Polar ice team???????????????
